messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: lefites/ was learning to read
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/26/02 7:18:02 AM Central Daylight Time, ... I don t know about that. The program I was watching only focused on the right/left thing. I
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/26/02 7:18:02 AM Central Daylight Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:


> That's for the mirror-image lefties, right? And when that's the case, are
> they also reversed as to major organs? The egg splitting face-to-face or
> something like that?
>
> Maybe no such a thing. I read it somewhere once and it seemed cool.
>
> Sandra

I don't know about that. The program I was watching only focused on the
right/left thing. I have only seen one case of someone with reversed organs
and they were not a twin. I was in training in the ER and one of my friends
was assisting in a car crash case. When it was discovered that the woman's
organs weren't were they were supposed to be, everyone heard about it. I am
thinking it is a very rare thing.
~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: lefites/ was learning to read
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/26/02 12:06:43 AM, Dnowens@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/26/02 12:06:43 AM, Dnowens@... writes:

<<
Moly eats, writes, and throws left but bats right and left. I once saw a
documentary of twins where someone was stating that many twins have one lefty
and that many people who are lefties were (at one time) twins. >>

That's for the mirror-image lefties, right? And when that's the case, are
they also reversed as to major organs? The egg splitting face-to-face or
something like that?

Maybe no such a thing. I read it somewhere once and it seemed cool.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: lefites/ was learning to read
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/26/02 12:28:16 AM Central Daylight Time, ... Moly eats, writes, and throws left but bats right and left. I once saw a documentary of twins
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/26/02 12:28:16 AM Central Daylight Time,
leschke@... writes:


> >My earliest reader is a leftie. Writes leftie, anyway. Bats right, throws
> >right, cuts left, writes left, eats left - until he was 4 or so he was a
> two
> >fisted eater, spoon in one hand, fork in the other. <g> Not that he's a
> >"normal" learner.
>
> Mine is the same, eats and writes left, throws and bats right. A much
> later reader.
> Tia

Moly eats, writes, and throws left but bats right and left. I once saw a
documentary of twins where someone was stating that many twins have one lefty
and that many people who are lefties were (at one time) twins. I found it
very interesting because Moly was a twin. (I lost her twin early in my
pregnancy) Are any of your lefties twins or were they a twin?
~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
